Reviews.Title: “Good overall, but some annoyances”
Reviews.Author: 4 Joyful Travel
Reviews.Content: We had a good-sized room with pleasant decor, a very comfortable recliner (much appreciated!), a comfortable desk chair, and an old-fashioned TV. There was a small microwave and a large mini-fridge with freezer. The AC unit was effective but noisy, and there was a fan over the bed (also much appreciated). The sink area was not separate from the bathroom, but there was plenty of counter space and the bathroom was well lit. It also had a good showerhead and plenty of hot water. The annoyances: *no light by the recliner for reading *only one chair at the desk/table combination *our suitcase didn't fit in the closet Breakfast included a good selection of items, including scrambled eggs that did not taste processed. El Pollo Loco and Sonic are adjacent to the hotel, and there are other restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: medic6bravo
Reviews.Content: This is a decent place to stay. Check in was not a problem...could be a little more friendly and not stern. The hotel is in decent shape, the rooms are spacious but the furniture is dated, dented and scratched. The carpets need a good cleaning. Our socks would get dirty just walking on the carpet. The locations is all right but the prostitutes on the street just outside the hotel are a huge distraction and makes you feel unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “Spring trip”
Reviews.Author: verngws
Reviews.Content: Great price. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was decent and for the three nights I stayed, they had a different hot item each morning. The property is not located close to much but there are a few stores and restaurants within a couple of blocks. I stayed in a lower level room and was able to hear people walking around so my suggestion would be to ask for a room on the upper level. The room was clean and although I did not have towels upon arrival, I was brought them as soon as I asked.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service and rooms--staff is very helpful and professional”
Reviews.Author: mmochel2281
Reviews.Content: excellent service, rooms great and professional staff

Reviews.Title: “Nice La Quinta”
Reviews.Author: Barry C
Reviews.Content: The customer Service at this property was excellent. Vickie, Leah and Denise were all very nice and really seemed to care about LQ's customers.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: harv e
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay. We stayed there for 7 days and every day was excellent. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. When I asked a lady at the front desk what we should be sure to do in Phenix she went out of her way to put together a package for me complete with Google maps and discount coupons. On the day we arrived the hot tub wasn't working and the next day Nathan at the front desk made sure we knew it had been repaired. The location of the pool area is also excellent since you can find both shade and sun whenever you want. The rooms and the whole hotel was very clean. The continental breakfast is also great with so many choices such as bacon and eggs, sausages, cereal, muffins and toast as well as numerous choices of beverage. I just can't think of a single negative thing to say about the hotel. We would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good experience!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia M
Reviews.Content: While in Phoenix for a dog show I stayed here for four nights. Even though the area around it was not the best, the hotel was clean, modern, safe and very reasonably priced. I was also pleasantly surprised at the very helpful staff, especially Vickie and Leah. I had accidently left my laptop in the lobby and not realized it for almost an hour. I thought for sure it was gone. They had picked it up and kept it safe behind the counter until I returned!! The helpfulness and honesty was truly refreshing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever”
Reviews.Author: Phillie C
Reviews.Content: It was a deliteful stay hospitality was great it's like being at home Thx. Vickie the prices were great.:)

Reviews.Title: “The price is right”
Reviews.Author: GPsy
Reviews.Content: This is a nice property at a very good price. You were welcomed with some refreshing ice water with sliced fruits and a pleasant staffer. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. The breakfast that is included is fine. In our room, the shower controls were badly in need of replacement, and the sink controls were also worn. The TV is flat screen, as advertised, but still an older CRT model. Our reservation specified a quiet area, but we were next to the workout room (think music and machines), in sight of the elevator, and along a corridor on the way to breakfast. Even worse, the floor above seemed very thin, and you would think was housing a gymnastics group practicing at all hours of the night. In fairness, we were offered to switch to another room the next day, but had been told the people above were checking out, so we decided not to have the hassle. That was a mistake: the noises continued. We would return, but only if we could be assured of a top floor room away from the elevator and vending areas.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: S4S4R1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is reasonably price, with clean and quiet rooms. The property is centrally located, close to shopping, restaurants and attractions. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Nance12
Reviews.Content: We go to alot of La Quintas because we have dogs, but this time, they didn't come along, and we loved our executive king room for three nights. This La Quinta was clean. It appears to have been renovated because it still had some older light switches, but they did a nice job and mirrors some new La Quinta's we have stayed in. They had the white updated bedspreads with lots of feather pillows, which I love. The beds did not appear to have the new softer pillow top mattress, as they were firm, but I slept fine. Breakfast was standard La Quinta fare. They had bacon or sausages, sometimes scrambled eggs. I would rate it in my top 10 La Quintas overall. Service was good, and they remembered our snack and water upon check in as we are Elite members.

Reviews.Title: “Staff made us feel welcome.”
Reviews.Author: Kathy A
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travel a bit and I read the reviews about this property being as it was the closest one to the U of Phoenix Stadium....We checked in on a saturday and because of the soccer game it was pretty busy, but the girl at the front desk in the evening handled it VERY WELL. She was polite recognized and greeted everyone who came in promptly and she had a very welcoming smile.. Rooms were very clean, property well kept, and staff was amazing. Next time we are phoenix this will be our first choice. Breakfast was out of this world for a "Continental Breakfast". Also they have some delicious Orange infused water. and complimentary cookies were great. The only issue I had was with kids running up and down the hall....But I was able to get past that.

Reviews.Title: “A good La Quinta”
Reviews.Author: AnAislingSkye
Reviews.Content: One of the newer ones and very nice.Outside pool and hot tub.Very clean rooms , pleasant staff and nice breakfast.Would stay again. La Quintas can be hit or miss , but this is certainly worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice after a long drive”
Reviews.Author: MaryAnnandPat
Reviews.Content: When we travel with our dog we always stay at a LaQuinta and not all LaQuinta's are created equal! We have stayed in a few that were absolutely horrible and others that were true gems. This one I would search out. My only complaint is that there wasn't a grassy dog walk area. Not surprising since it's a dessert area, but it would have been nice. Otherwise, we very much enjoyed our overnight there and the great breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice!”
Reviews.Author: chicagotoots
Reviews.Content: Chose this LQ over another after reading the reviews. This one was just fine - suite using points and $30 up grade charge, room was clean, "guest ready", very helpful evening desk clerk, quiet. Breakfast was an upgrade from the usual LQ - included warm biscuits and gravy and bacon, fruit, yogart, waffels, etc. Good location off the expressway, right near a Sonic drive in, pet friendly, nice outdoor swimming pool and hot tub. Definitely a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: eandjwein
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week on business. The GM arranged our reservations personally and he got us a good deal. I chose this property based on price and customer reviews on TripAdvisor. We had stayed at one other La Quinta before so we were a bit wary going in, but this property is well maintained, the housekeeping staff is terrific, the free breakfast area was clean and fresh, and while we seemed to be far from downtown, it didn't take long to get there using the surface streets. The only down side is that the floors and walls are thin and the neighborhood has seen better days. We felt better seeing there was a Holiday Inn and several other mid-level properties nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent La Quinta”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth32655
Reviews.Content: Seems like a new La Quinta- very clean. Some nice personal touches like a pitcher of water with oranges out front, lotion in the bathroom - clean rooms, new sheets and towels. Very dog friendly. Something to note- you will need to travel at least 5 miles for a decent restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelRN2010
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel if you were on I-10 West and you desperately needed a place to rest for the night. However, I would not stay longer than that. At first glance the outside of the hotel is new, but the location of this hotel is terrible! Once inside there was very little noise pollution, it was some what clean, but the beds were not comfortable. The hotel claims to be 100% smoke free, but it is not. I could still smell a lingering trail, which effects my breathing. It would be nice to stay at a real 100% smoke free hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: tia_derr
Reviews.Content: Reception area had pitcher of ice water with orange wedges. Room had soft white linen on the bed with comforator encased. This was the first hotel we ever stayed in where we had no fear of those germy bed spreads bugs. The hotel was quite at night, however convienently located in Pheonix. In the morning, we ate a relaxing and wonderful continental breakfast. They even outfitted a Cabela's waffle making iron for a more elaborate bk. While checking out, I overheard the another receptionist scrambling to help settle in a wiry (spelling) 24 hour traveler. The hotel was most excellently maintained... no chips, no mold, and the decor was modern. After I stepped outside to check out the pool and hot tub, Ii wished we had stayed another night. Next time, we will bring our youngs kids to stay there when we travel. /// If there was one think to recommend, classica-type music playing in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, great staff, close to Sky Harbor Airport”
Reviews.Author: LovinLouisville
Reviews.Content: Very nice room, comfortable, excellent staff. Nice breakfast, and the cost was an excellent value. Ten minutes via freeway to Sky Harbor, and for the money, it would be hard to beat this! El Polly Loco, a good Mexican fast food place, is right next door. Small, but good fitness center, too.

Reviews.Title: “Very unsafe hotel, they only care about the money!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: blanclila
Reviews.Content: When I fell in a pothole beside the sidewalk (no lights in this area!) and thought my arm was broken, the manager asked me sarcastically, "What do you want me to do about it?". As I stood there bleeding profusely from my right arm and leg, his attitude was completely uncaring. As a mother traveling alone with my little boy, who witnessed my accident and was terrified, I was beyond shocked at the complete lack of human compassion and caring. The hotel clerk offered me a band-aid - really?? - with a wound the size of a baseball dripping blood and my elbow swollen so bad I couldn't move it? Being out of state and alone with a young son, I had no idea at 10:00pm where to go for urgent care. Not only did the staff not offer to help in any way, they had no idea where to go for care. Their only suggestion was to call an ambulance, which was ridiculous as my injuries were not life threatening. The manager refused to take any responsibility for the pothole and lack of lighting (the sidewalk was right beside the building just outside the exit door from our room leading to their parking lot). He did not even place a sign near the pothole to warn other guests. When I asked him to comp the room for the night since I got no sleep due to my injuries and the hotel being at fault, he refused and gave me the number for La Quinta's legal dept. Apparently, this company would rather be sued than provide a safe environment and compassionate staff for their guests - yes, that is exactly what I was told by the legal dept when I telephoned them. When I explained I only wanted the refund of the one night stay, they said, "That is not our policy. You must file a legal claim". Being injured was bad enough, why not just be kind and caring to your guests?

Reviews.Title: “Pigeon Poo”
Reviews.Author: BethInHouston
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nothing special - I'm not sure why the glowing reviews - I have stayed at MUCH nicer La Quintas in many states. We had a significant problem during our stay last week. We checked in around 4:30 pm and were offered a room on the ground floor - we declined that because I found the surrounding area a bit questionable. Across from the parking lot we saw people moving along with their shopping carts of worldly possessions and the bold sign of the "We Buy Gold" store. We were given a room on the third floor (good so far). When we got to the room and opened the curtain it was practically impossible to see out window due to the pigeon poo that COVERED the window. I don't mean those annoying splats you get on your car... we're talking major spray and/or pigeon blowout here. Also, along the railing outside the window was a layer of poo about an inch deep. There is NO way that housekeeping would not have noticed the window problem and reported it to management. I went to the front desk to tell them about the disgusting window. The response was to the effect that "We have a pigeon problem" and "You can stay there or take the room on the ground floor." Apparently there were NO other rooms at 4:30 in the afternoon available at the hotel. Hard to believe that EVERYONE had checked in by then since the parking lot was mostly empty. I was told that specific rooms were held for "elite" level customers (I guess we're only "gold" level). Interestingly enough the breakfast room only had about 6 other people the next morning (at a time when most hotels are usually 5 people deep just waiting for the waffle maker) and the parking lot was still not full. I asked to speak with a manger, but was told none was there (at 4:30 pm) and when I asked again the next morning (around 8:30) was told again there was no manager on site. We paid over $100 for the night. The woman at the desk that morning did give us a $10 discount - gee thanks. (Oh, and I won't go into the mysterious brown smudge that I had to wipe off of the thermostat - I'm going to keep telling myself it wasn't anything organic)

Reviews.Title: “Super place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bigbirdbc
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights - the staff and rooms were great. The only thing lacking is a good restaurant close by.

Reviews.Title: “A blessing to a tired soul”
Reviews.Author: businessisgood
Reviews.Content: I was there the last day 1/31/10. My breakfast was very nice, the lady pleased all her customers. The front desk girl was also nice. The place was so clean and beautiful. I will be back and tell others about this well hidden gem in the Valley of Phoenix, Arizona.

Reviews.Title: “Very good except for location”
Reviews.Author: FoxTerrierMom
Reviews.Content: We're traveling through the SW on a road trip with our dog so are limited to hotels that are pet friendly. We chose this based on reviews here and the fact that it was new. I can say that the staff was excellent. All were friendly, helpful, cheerful. Hotel is new and clean with standard LQ furniture. Used the exercise room - nothing fancy but fully functional. My only complaint was location. Road outside had a "no cruising" notice posted, neighborhood was somewhat depressed and made me a bit uncomfortable. However, inside hotel was fine, completely secure.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: Ellesmereporters
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights on the way back to Phoenix Airport at the end of our holiday. The rooms were roomy & clean but three light fittings didn't work, and neither did the TV remote. The pool was closed for one day when an underwater light fitting loosened and floated to the top of the water with electrical cables attached to the mains!! When visiting the breakfast area at 9.20am one morning, vitually nothing was left and it wasn't replenished. We had cereal and toast and that was it!! The redeeming feature at this hotel was Anthony on front desk. He was extremely welcoming, friendly and made us feel at home. I would stay there again because of the service given to us by him.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, but lots of missing services.”
Reviews.Author: smb9h
Reviews.Content: Clean room, clean facility, comfortable beds. However, remote control didn't work. When we tried to call the front desk about it we found the phone didn't work! The clerk sounded as though she'd heard about the phone in 208 before. We had to request a laundry bag. Internet only worked for about 5 minutes. (We were offered a new room). In a.m. we found the room stocked with decaf coffee only. Breakfast was typical eggs/juice/breads.

Reviews.Title: “Love La Quinta......”
Reviews.Author: greaterwolves
Reviews.Content: The room was great. Was there 9 days and totally enjoyed sneaking down to the lobby for a wide variety of breakfast delights. Omelettes, pigs in a blanket, waffles, yogurt, muffins, danish, choices and more choices. The staff was wonderful and cheery with a greeting everytime we came into the lobby. Many amenities available to the guests. Pool, exercise room. the rooms had a hair dryers, a microwave, small fridge and a coffee pot with coffee. Puts you in a good vacation mood when the staff makes everyone feel welcome. After loosing my confirmation numbers for the rental car and getting a serious 2 hour run around with it, it was wonderful to be greeted so wonderfully by the staff when we checked in. I booked my room in advance via the La Quinta Inn's website...

Reviews.Title: “Nice and New”
Reviews.Author: xtreat
Reviews.Content: We booked this particular La Quinta because its location off I-10 was convenient for our long roadtrip. Great price on hotel website, and room was new and clean. My son liked the pool, and it was nice to have complementary waffles and fruit for breakfast. Staff were friendly and helpful. There were a couple of shady characters hanging around outside, but we never felt unsafe. I have a feeling this area might not be the best part of town.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable Place”
Reviews.Author: BeingGreen
Reviews.Content: This was not our first choice when we searched for a hotel for an extended weekend stay to be near family. We needed three rooms and most of Phoenix was booked due to sports events taking place in the area. We could only find rooms here and at the Hampton on the other side of I-10 that would be anywhere near the area where we needed to be so after sending a family member to scout out the two properties, this one was deemed to be preferable. One reason it was preferable is that while it is close to the interstate it does not sit directly on it, but is located somewhat back from the traffic. There is a row of other budget hotels between this property and the interstate highway--a Travel Lodge and some local extended stay hotel. So you do not hear the traffic noise from the interestate in this property--some noise from McDowell, a five-lane busy street, but not loud enough to be annoying. The hotel is new as the previous person posted and still had a banner proclaiming it as "Now Open" when we arrived 3/22. Our rooms were listed as suites and we paid $124/nt. for them. They were spacious with a separate sofa, two chairs, a round table, coffee table and desk with leather swivel chair as well as the dresser, two night tables, and the tall wooden cabinet that held the flat-screen TV and contained a fridge and microwave. There were two phones, one portable, and there was ethernet connectivity at the desk. The desk had multiple electrical outlets which was a nice feature. The bathroom had a single sink in the marble counter and a tub with shower. Good water pressure. There was a coffee pot in the bathroom, and an ironing board and iron in the closet. The closet had a mirrored door and there was a full length mirror on the opposite wall--another thoughtful item. The furniture appeared to be nicer than that found in many discount hotels and I did not have any problem with the bed or the pillows. Standard thin flowered covering on the bed, thin towels, and basic amenities in the bathroom. The breakfast in the morning was adequate--two waffle machines to make y our own waffle--pastries, bagels, white bread, cereals, juices (orange, grapefruit, apple), fruit (apples,oranges, bananas), and coffee. There is a loud flat-screen TV in the breakfast area and the breakfast crowd seemed to be mostly young people with their coaches. Despite the large number of what appeared to be sports teams at the hotel the place was very quiet. There were menus of area restaurants at the front desk and the staff seemed willing to help. I did not visit the fitness room or business center nor did I notice if the pool was functioning. We did not spend much time at the property except to sleep. There is a Sonic and a Pollo Loco within walking distance and a large Chevron station with a convenience store at the corner of McDowell and 51st. There is a Waffle House and several small local places across the five lanes of McDowell. There is a Food City Grocery, also across the street and within walking distance if one is up to crossing the busy street. Most of the businesses in the area have Spanish names and it appears to be a very bustling commercial district with what appears to be multi-family housing directly across the street from the hotel. I say appears to be because there is a high concrete block wall separating McDowell from these units. I saw policemen pull cars over on McDowell on two of my trips back to the hotel at night so it seems to be an area with a lot of police presence, but I did not feel uncomfortable at the hotel.If I had been traveling alone I think I would have still felt comfortable as the parking lot is well-lit and there appears to be a fair amount of pedestrian traffic in the area. The only problem we experienced here was with the elevator. We were on the third floor and the elevator often stopped on the second floor and refused to go to the third floor. On the day we were checking out with lots of luggage we waited with many others at the elevator. One couple waiting said they had been stuck on the elevator the day before. We finally gave up and walked down the stairs carrying our heavy suitcases. This was annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facility, short on staffing”
Reviews.Author: TravelFan
Reviews.Content: I booked this particular LaQuinta because the website said it was new. This hotel is new, but they seem to be still working out the "kinks." For instance, the pool is still not open as of March 2007. At breakfast, the same person who was working the front desk also had to keep the breakfast area stocked. Needless to say, one person could not do this job adequately as the hotel was completely booked. Guests had to clean their own tables in the breakfast area, and the food supply kept running out. Other than that, our stay was quite acceptable. I appreciate the free wireless internet, nice clean rooms with a mini-fridge and microwave. The beds were comfortable (but not the pillows). There is a small work out room and business center, but I only looked in; didn't actually use these two rooms. This is a typical close to the inter-state hotel. There's a fast-food mexican food place next door, and also a Sonic, but not much else. Hopefully, they will work out the staffing and get the pool open in the near future. However, for a nice clean new room, this is a good hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: La Quinta Inn & Suites Phoenix I-10 West
HotelInfo.Address: 4929 West McDowell Road, Phoenix, AZ 85035
